'''Lossarnach''' was a region in the south of [[Gondor]].<ref name=RC>{{HM|UI}}, entry ''Lossarnach'', p. 513</ref><ref name=Map>{{RK|Map}}</ref>

==Geography==
Lossarnach was located near the sources of the rivers [[Sirith]] and [[Erui]] in the north-east<ref>{{UT|Index}}, entry ''Lossarnach''</ref><ref group=note>The entry for ''Lossarnach'' in [[J.R.R. Tolkien]]'s [[Unfinished index]] for [[The Lord of the Rings]] mentions it as "the region of NW [north-west] Lebennin", but it is located in the north-east of Lebennin on the [[Map of Rohan, Gondor, and Mordor|maps]] and [[Christopher Tolkien]] mentions in the entry for ''Lossarnach'' in his index for [[Unfinished Tales|Unfinished Tales of Númenor and Middle-earth]] that it is "in the north-east of Lebennin".</ref> of [[Lebennin]]<ref name=RC/> south of the eastern end of the [[White Mountains]].<ref name=Map/> The name Lossarnach or Arnach referred to the valleys in the south of the White Mountains and to their foothills between the rivers [[Celos]] and Erui.<ref name=VT17>{{VT|42a}}, p. 17</ref> Many flowers grew in its upper valleys. Below is upper valleys were great orchards of fruit trees, which supplied much of the fruit that was required in [[Minas Tirith]]. People from Minas Tirith often made trips to Lossarnach to look at the flowers and the blossoms of the fruit trees.<ref name=VT18>{{VT|42a}}, p. 18</ref>

==History==
During the [[War of the Ring]] before the [[Siege of Minas Tirith]], the elderly and most of the women and children were sent to [[Tumladen (Gondor)|Tumladen]] and Lossarnach to seek refuge.<ref>{{RK|MT}}, p. 764</ref> The lord of Lossarnach, old [[Forlong]] the Fat, led two hundred men to aid in the defence Minas Tirith.<ref name=MT>{{RK|MT}}, p. 770</ref> Forlong was killed in the [[Battle of the Pelennor Fields]],<ref>{{RK|Battle}}, p. 846</ref> but many of his men survived and accompanied [[Aragorn]] Elessar on his way to the [[Black Gate]], even though most of them were farmers.<ref>{{RK|Gate}}, p. 886</ref> It is possible that the mountain-vales, where the ancestors of [[Beregond]] came from, were located in Lossarnach.<ref>{{RK|MT}}, pp. 760</ref>

Famous people from the region included the wise-woman [[Ioreth]] who served in the [[Houses of Healing]] of Minas Tirith,<ref>{{RK|Houses}}, p. 866</ref> and [[Morwen Steelsheen]], wife of King [[Thengel]] of [[Rohan]].<ref>{{App|Mark}}, ''Second Line'', entry 16. ''Thengel''</ref><ref>{{UT|Linear}}, note to Morwen, Thengel's wife</ref>

==Etymology==
[[File:Mark Fisher - Ithilien.png|left|thumb|180px|Map of eastern Gondor, by Mark Fisher]]
''Lossarnach'' is a mixed [[Sindarin]] and [[Pre-Númenórean]] name. It means "flowery Arnach".<ref name=RC/> The second element, ''[[Arnach]]'' is a Pre-Númenórean name whose origin is forgotten.<ref>{{App|Men}}, p. 1129</ref> It is unclear why ''[[loss]]'', the Sindarin word for "snow", was prefixed to Arnach. It is probable that ''loss'' referred to the blossoms of the fruit trees. The words for flower, ''[[loth]]'', and for snow, ''loss'' are very similar in Sindarin.<ref name=VT18/> The [[Númenóreans|Númenórean]] settlers, mariners, soldiers and other emigrants, who gave names to the places in Gondor in the [[Second Age]],  did not know Sindarin well.<ref name=VT17/> As a consequence, it is possible that they confused the Sindarin word for flowers with the Sindarin word for snow.

==Inspiration==
[[Letter to Jennifer Brookes-Smith (28 July 1955)|Writing in a letter]] about an impending trip in [[1955]], [[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]] identified Lossarnach as [[Wikipedia:Assisi|Assisi]].<ref>{{CG|C}}, p. 462</ref>

==Portrayal in adaptations==
[[File:The Lord of the Rings Online - Lossarnach map.jpg|thumb|right|Map of Lossarnach in''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'' ]]
'''2015: ''[[The Lord of the Rings Online]]'':'''
:Lossarnach was an area in the region of Eastern [[Gondor]]. It was across the river [[Erui]] from Upper [[Lebennin]] to the west and across the river [[Anduin]] from South [[Ithilien]] to the east. The [[Rammas Echor]] divided it from the [[Pelennor Fields|Pelennor]] to the north-east. Settlements in Lossarnach included the capital city of Arnach, [[Imloth Melui]], [[Harlond (Gondor)|Harlond]], and "Ost Norhir", though the latter two have fallen to the [[Minas Morgul|Morgul]]-host. The emblem of Lossarnach was three red roses on a white field. Baranor, Captain of the Guard of Arnach, and the Lady Vanyalos, sister of [[Denethor]] and wife of [[Forlong]], were in charge of the land when Forlong went to [[Minas Tirith]].
